title: Need help updating gfx card
body:
Hey, i have a pretty old computer but it still runs fast so i don't want to buy a whole new one. My graphics card is out of date and not good for gaming so i would like to upgrade, im not sure what kind of card is compatible with my system though.

Processor: AMD Phenom(tm) II X4 955 3.20GHz
Graphics: ATI Radeon 3000
Ram: 8GB
Display: 1920 x 1080 (32bit) 60Hz

Any help would be appreciated!

replies.body:
We can probably make some assumptions from the specifications you've provided, however, without a system brand and model number or the motherboard type, it'll be hard to really know what is compatible with your system.

For video cards, it'll come down to 2 things: interface (usually PCIe) and power supply (PSU). The former because we need to know what cards your motherboard is compatible with and the latter so we know that the video card you're getting won't be too much for your PSU to handle.

Depending on some computers, you might also want to make sure that the video card you want to install will fit inside the machine. This problem isn't as common as it was back in the day, but it is still good practice to make sure that it'll physically fit in your computer.

You might want to look for something close to this: 

- http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150577

That's a Radeon HD 6670 which is a newer variant of the Radeon HD 5670 listed in the [Minimum and Recommend Requirements](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements) page.

Alternatively, you can go with a slightly beefier Radeon R7 250X like this one:

- http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814131662

If you're looking for something from the GeForce camp, this is also a good card:

- http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814127788

Now remember, you'll want to make sure that the video cards are compatible with your system before picking up any computer part. If you're unsure, I highly recommend having a friend with technical knowledge or someone knowledgeable help you out.

About how fast you think League would run?? Like, what would the fps in game be with those specs?? I have come across people with some godly fps and their reaction timing with quicker gameplay. Like up to 220+, 500+, and I even know some that gets 700fps like holy crap. While the average people get is 60-90fps.

Heya
I am not that hardware savvy but i think over 100 should be possible. But that is not the reason i am posting here^^

However, if your monitor is only 60Hz there is no reason to have more than 60 FPS. (Hz is the rate in wich the picture on the monitor refreshes). If you have a 144Hz Monitor you might want to have 144Fps. Having more FPS is ultimately a waste of energy since they cannot be displayed. Also they might even cause issues( i remember having a few cases where ppl had around 300+ Fps and got a slow motion effect).

Regards Rkoturdo

Hmmm. I was also reading about the 60Hz thing. I wonder what some people have. I know this one dude that gets like 500+ fps and it doesn't go slow for him. So I guess his monitor isn't 60Hz. I will have to check the two new monitors tomorrow that'll be coming with my new pc. My laptop monitor is apparently 60Hz though I get 90 FPS in game. So how fast a monitor refreshes can also determine how much FPS you can get??

Heya
No, how fast the monitor refreshes does not determine how many FPS you can have. They are seperate things. 
But if you have 120 FPS the Monitor(60Hz) only refreshes every two frames(simplified) since he is not capable of refreshing fast enough to show all the Frames per Second. So they are not the same but are somewhat tied together. Its like a webside updating every 4 Minutes what is shown but everey 2 Minutes the content is changed. The side would just display half of the content since some of the changed would never be updated. Maybe that makes it a little bit clearer.

To the Slowmotion effect. Not every person with that high FPS numbers gets them, just a few had it.

Regards Rkoturdo

Wow. 2009. That's pretty old.

I have the same system you have, the videocard I'm using now is a Radeon 7700HD, works very well for everything...and it's reasonably cheap.

if you want to save a few bucks you can get ahold of a GTX550 and it'll do the job decently enough.

a minimum video RAM of 1GB is more than enough for workable FPS in league. anymore than that and you're going for higher detail and larger display.

1GB should give you at least 25-55 FPS with that CPU / MEMORY setup I believe.

If you can get ahold of W10 and upgrade the system I'm hearing that it adds some FPS to older rigs. 

Mine for example has 4 CPU's, 4GB of RAM but I'm using an INTEL HD video card and switching from windows 8.1  - windows 10 has increased my FPS significantly.

But I'd also suggest visiting a REAL tech at a computer supplier. (do not rely on the doofuses in office supply stores for technical advice...some of them don't even know wtf  FIRMWARE is!!)
